p.codeblock: public void initMediaEngine(AsyncCallback callBack) throws RteException

section.p: This is an asynchronous method that returns the initialization result via a callback function. You need to call this method after creating the RTE object and setting the App ID.
section.note: The return value of only indicates whether the initialization operation was successfully enqueued to the asynchronous task queue, not whether the initialization itself succeeded.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called after creating the RTE object and setting the App ID.

plentry.pd: Callback for asynchronous notification of the initialization result. You can obtain the result or error code via the err parameter of this callback. See .

An output parameter. Indicates the status or error information generated during initialization. See . When calling , if an immediately detectable error occurs (such as invalid parameters or insufficient resources), the SDK synchronously returns the error information through this parameter.
Callback for asynchronously returning the engine initialization result. See .

section.title: Exceptions
section.p: If initialization fails, the SDK throws an exception and returns the corresponding error information. You need to catch and handle the exception.

ul.li: : Successfully enqueued the initialization operation to the asynchronous task queue.
: Failed to enqueue the initialization operation to the asynchronous task queue.

p.ph: This return value only indicates whether the initialization operation was successfully enqueued, not whether the initialization itself succeeded.
